title: What goods did Europeans send to the East in trade? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Dutch started their trading with an empty ship and a lot of money (gold and silver). In the journey to the east they bought and sold anything they could get. Dutch East India Company - Wikipedia That is most important reason people are mostly interested in diving/searching for Dutch ships sunken on their way out. The trade was not between Holland and East-indies, but between India, far east, china, japan.

Mercedes, BMW, Volkswagen, Airbus, pharma products etc…. However, India is not really an importing nation of consumer goods such as other Asian countries. India likes to export and consumes locally made goods. So I presume your question is more about consumer goods such as for instance mobiles, TV, refrigerators etc… they mainly come from China, Korea, Japan. and not so much from Europe. Europe is mostly luxury goods and now even these are manufactured in Asia.
